column3: OPTION INFORMATION
Provide an entry for working directory name seperated by \\ at each new subdirectory.
Provide an entry of the data file (csv fil) name without csv extension.
Provide an entry name for the stratigraphy output file (outputs are automatically in eps format and can be opened in Inkscape or similar). Do not add any file extensions.
Provide and entry  for an other output file format.  Options are png, jpeg or 'none' if not required.
Provide an entry for the canvas width. This is in mm and therefore users can measure their monitor to ensure canvas will fit/fill enough of the screen.
Provide an entry for the canvas height. This is in mm and therefore users can measure their monitor to ensure canvas will fit/fill enough of the screen.
Provide an entry for the figure scale factor. This is the ratio reduction of the entire canvas that the actual figure will use. Values between 0.5 and 1 are suggested with 0.7 as a start.
Provide an entry for the borderwidth around the stratigraphy core plotting area and the axes. Provide in mm.
Provide an entry for the main title on or off. Options are on or off.
Provide an entry of text for main title if required.
Provide an entry for the main title text colour if required (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for the main title text font size if required.
Provide an entry for the main title style if required. Available options are normal, bold or italic.
Provide an entry for minor vertical adjustment for main title in mm if required. Positive values move upward, negative downward. If no adjustment required provide an entry of 0 (zero).
Provide an entry for minor horizontall adjustment for main title in mm if required. Positive values move upward, negative downward. If no adjustment required provide an entry of 0 (zero).
Provide an entry for X axis line colour (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for X axis line width. Entries between 1 and 3 are typical.
Provide an entry for x title on or off. Options are on or off.
Provide an entry for x axis title line 1 if required.
Provide an entry for x axis title line 2 if required.
Provide an entry for X axis title font size if required.
Provide an entry for X title colour if required (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for X_axis title font style if required. Available options are normal, bold or italic.
Provide an entry for minor vertical adjustment for x axis title if required in mm. Positive values move upward, negative downward.
Provide an entry for minor horizontal adjustment for x axis title if required in mm. Positive values move upward, negative downward.
Provide an entry for X axis major tick labels to be added to axis. Separate each with * . There should be no spaces.
Provide an entry for X major shift if required. If no shift is needed add a 0 (zero). See manual for further details.
Provide an entry for  the decimal places required for major axis ticks.
Provide an entry for X axis major tick length in mm.
Provide an entry for X axis major tick width in mm.
Provide an entry for X axis tick colour (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for X minor ticks on or off. Options are on or off.
Provide an entry for X minor tick length in mm if required.
Provide an entry for X axis minor tick width if required
Provide an entry for X axis minor tick colour if required(colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for X minor ticks maximum value if required.
Provide an entry for X minor ticks step increment if required.
Provide an entry for X axis label font size (x and y are treated the same).
Provide an entry for X axis label colour (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for X axis label font style. Available options are normal, bold or italic.
Provide an entry for minor vertical adjustment for X major tick label if required in mm. Positive values move upward, negative downward. If no adjustment required provide an entry of 0 (zero).
Provide an entry for minor horizontal adjustment for X major tick label if required in mm. Positive values move right, negative left. If no adjustment required provide an entry of 0 (zero).
Provide an entry for Y axis colour (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for Y axis line width.
Provide an entry for y title on or off. Options are on or off.
Provide an entry for y axis title line 1 if required.
Provide an entry for y axis title line 2 if required.
Provide an entry for Y axis title font size if required.
Provide an entry for y_axis title font style if required. Available options are normal, bold or italic.
Provide an entry for Y title colour if required(colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for minor vertical adjustment for y axis title if required in mm. Positive values move upward, negative downward.
Provide an entry for minor horizontal adjustment for y axis title if required in mm. Positive values move upward, negative downward.
Provide an entry for y axis major tick labels to be added to axis. Separate each with * . There should be no spaces.
Provide an entry for y_major_ticks_depth_mode. See manual for details.
Provide an entry for decimal places required for major axis ticks.
Provide an entry for Y axis major tick length in mm.
Provide an entry for Y axis major tick width.
Provide an entry for Y axis major tick colour (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for Y axis label font size (x and y are treated the same).
Provide an entry for Y axis label colour (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for Y axis label font style. Available options are normal, bold or italic.
Provide an entry for minor vertical adjustment for Y major tick label if required in mm. Positive values move upward, negative downward. If no adjustment required provide an entry of 0 (zero).
Provide an entry for minor horizontal adjustment for Y major tick label if required in mm. Positive values move right, negative left. If no adjustment required provide an entry of 0 (zero).
Provide an entry for Y minor ticks on or off. Options are on or off.
Provide an entry for Y minor tick length in mm if required.
Provide an entry for Y axis minor tick width if required
Provide an entry for Y axis minor tick colour if required(colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for Y minor ticks maximum value if required.
Provide an entry for Y minor ticks step increment if required.
Provide an entry for Y grid lines on or off. Options are on or off.
Provide an entry for Y grid style if required. Options are dashed or solid. Dash length can be altered with dash length below allowing graduation to a dotted effect.
Provide an entry for Y grid line colour if required (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for Y grid line width if required.
Provide an entry for Y grid lengths. Add more length if required in mm.
Provide an entry for Y grid dash length in mm if required. Each dash will be this long.
Provide an entry for surface join line on or off.Options are on or off.
Provide an entry for surface join line colour if required (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for surface join line width (typically use value of 1 to 3) if required.
Provide an entry for surface join style if required. Available options are dashed or solid.
Provide an entry for surface join line dash length if required in mm. Each dash will be this long.
Provide an entry for base join line on or off.Options are on or off.
Provide an entry for base join line colour if required (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Provide an entry for base join line width (typically use value of 1 to 3) if required.
Provide an entry for base join style if required. Available options are dashed or solid.
Provide an entry for base join line dash length if required in mm. Each dash will be this long.
Provide an entry for stratigraphy rectangle width used in the Troels Smith stratigraphy plots (one of the four that make up the TS scheme). Provide in mm.

Provide an entry for Line colour to be used for the rectangles used in the Troels Smith stratigraphy plots (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
Entry of 'on' or 'off' is required here. This will allow the plotting of non TS like 4 part rectangles if the same entries are supplied such as Tl-Tl-Tl-Tl. See manual for examples.

Provide an entry for colour used for Argilla granosa. Follow with '-n' if not required as part of the associated legend (colours can be selected from matplotlib named colours https://matplotlib.org/stable/gallery/color/named_colors.html).
